tax_brackets.source: Gemini Web Search, 2025-08-10, 'New Zealand income tax rates 1967'
tax_brackets.notes: The values here are an approximation of the 1967 tax system. The rates are the 1966 rates with a 10% rebate applied. This rebate was capped at $200, which is not modelled here. The top rate of 68% is from previous years and is assumed to be the maximum rate. The currency was decimalized in 1967, and the threshold is an assumption in dollars.

ietc.notes: The 10% tax rebate is modelled in the tax brackets. The $200 cap on the rebate is not modelled.

wff.notes: NEEDS RESEARCH. WFF did not exist. The rules for historical family assistance programs are unknown.

ppl.notes: NEEDS RESEARCH. Paid Parental Leave scheme of 1967 is unknown.

child_support.notes: NEEDS RESEARCH. Child support rules for 1967 is unknown.

acc_levy.source: Gemini Web Search, 2025-08-10, 'New Zealand income tax rates 1967'
acc_levy.notes: This represents the 'Social Security Income Tax' of 7.5%. The first $208 of annual income (Â£104) was exempt from this tax, which is not modelled here. The name 'acc_levy' is used due to the current data structure. There was no income cap mentioned for this tax.
